While I do agree that skillshots can be buggy at times, I don't think it's that straight forward. Latency on both sides can effect the way things seem. I've had instances where my skillshots have traveled perfectly through the middle of an enemy, only to not hit them completely. I thought it was a massive bug, but upon watching the replay, I realized I had in fact missed my target altogether, and this is with me sitting at a stable 50~ MS ping.

 The point I'm trying to make here is things aren't as clear cut as they seem. We also can't take into account just how big / what shape a champions hitbox is / spell is with accuracy. The way things are coded (I believe) are if 2 hitboxes overlap even slightly, it counts as a hit. Since we have no indication of actual champion / spell hitboxes, it's hard to accurately say that any of these should be considered hit / miss. Just my 2 cents.

Sion's Q isn't an issue at all. The problem is with how champion hitboxes work. Because his Q indicator lies along the ground, people naturally look at their champion's feet when trying to get out. However, that isn't where your hitbox is. Your hitbox has to encompass your entire champion, so if your arms/shoulders/belly or whatever are wider than your feet, your hitbox is, as well. That's why it looks like you're just outside of the indicator, when you actually aren't.
